SEARCH
Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.arrays.backend

Interface CsrMatrixMixin<T extends CsrMatrixMixin<T,U,V,W,X,Y>,U extends DenseMatrixMixinOld<U,?,W,X,Y>,V extends SparseVectorMixin<V,W,?,U,X,Y>,W extends DenseVectorMixin<W,V,U,X,Y>,X,Y>

Type Parameters:
T - Type of this sparse CSR matrix.
U - Type of dense matrix equivalent to T.
V - Type of vector similar to T.
W - Type of dense vector equivalent to V.
Y - Type (or wrapper of) of an element of this matrix.
All Superinterfaces:
MatrixMixinOld<T,U,V,W,X,Y>, MatrixVectorOpsMixin<T,V,W>, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<T,T>, TensorMixin<T,X,Y>
All Known Implementing Classes:
CsrCMatrix, CsrFieldMatrix, CsrFieldMatrixBase, CsrMatrix
public interface CsrMatrixMixin<T extends CsrMatrixMixin<T,U,V,W,X,Y>,U extends DenseMatrixMixinOld<U,?,W,X,Y>,V extends SparseVectorMixin<V,W,?,U,X,Y>,W extends DenseVectorMixin<W,V,U,X,Y>,X,Y> extends MatrixMixinOld<T,U,V,W,X,Y>
This interface specifies methods which all sparse CSR matrices should implement.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default double
    density()
    The density of this sparse CSR matrix.
    void
    sortIndices()
    Sorts the indices of this tensor in lexicographical order while maintaining the associated value for each index.
    double
    sparsity()
    The sparsity of this sparse CSR matrix.
    U
    toDense()
    Converts this sparse matrix to an equivalent dense matrix.

  • Method Details

    • density

      default double density()
      The density of this sparse CSR matrix. That is, the decimal percentage of elements in this matrix which are non-zero.
      Returns:
      The density of this sparse matrix.

    • sparsity

      double sparsity()
      The sparsity of this sparse CSR matrix. That is, the decimal percentage of elements in this matrix which are zero.
      Returns:
      The density of this sparse matrix.

    • toDense

      U toDense()
      Converts this sparse matrix to an equivalent dense matrix.
      Returns:
      A dense matrix equivalent to this sparse CSR matrix.

    • sortIndices

      void sortIndices()
      Sorts the indices of this tensor in lexicographical order while maintaining the associated value for each index.
